question: What is the main purpose of the International Development Association?
option1: To make loans on more flexible terms for important development projects in underdeveloped countries
option2: To make loans on more flexible terms for important development projects in developed countries
option3: To participate in development of irrigation projects in developing countries
answer: To make loans on more flexible terms for important development projects in underdeveloped countries
explanation: IDA aims to reduce poverty by providing loans and grants for programs that boost economic growth, reduce inequalities, and improve people\'s living conditions. The main objective of the establishment of the International Development Association is to provide credit to semi-developed and developing countries. The institution provides loan on easy terms. The purpose of the loan is to improve the living standard by increasing the economic growth rate of these countries.
